ygData.msgSnippet: Hi Matteo, One possibility for why you are still crawling images is where you placed that MatchesListRegexDecideRule in your decide rule sequence. Heritrix

Hi Matteo,
One possibility for why you are still crawling images is where y=
ou placed that MatchesListRegexDecideRule in your decide rule sequence. Her=
itrix goes through the set of rules in order and for each rule sets the sta=
tus of the URI being tested to ACCEPT, REJECT, or PASS. At the end of the d=
ecide rules, the status in place is the one used, so even if your MatchesLi=
stRegexDecideRule rejects the URI, a later rule may change that status to A=
CCEPT. For example, your regex might rule out the URI, but if after that ru=
le you have a TransclusionDecideRule, that "accepts any URI whose path-from=
-seed ends in at least one non-navlink hop" (https://webarchive.jira.com/wi=
ki/display/Heritrix/Configuring+Crawl+Scope+Using+DecideRules) and is gener=
ally used to accept embedded content such as images and videos no matter th=
e URI pattern, the URI would be ruled back in to acceptance. You could try =
moving your MatchesListRegexDecideRule lower in the chain of rules and see =
if that helps.

Lauren Ko
Web Archiving Programmer
UNT Libraries
__________=
______________________________
From: archive-crawler@yahoogroups.com [archi=
ve-crawler@yahoogroups.com] on behalf of matteo.ceccarello@... [matte=
o.ceccarello@...]
Sent: Tuesday, January 29, 2013 6:26 AM
To: archive=
-crawler@yahoogroups.com
Subject: [archive-crawler] [Heritrix 3] exclude im=
ages, videos and archives from being crawled

Hi all, we are trying to excl=
ude images, videos and archives from the set of URIs being crawled with a M=
atchesListRegexDecideRule:







".*\.(jpeg|jpg|png|tiff|gif)$"

".*\.(mpg=
|webm|ogg|flv)$"

".*\.(mp3|oga|wav)$"

".*\.(iso|tar|gz|zip|rar|exe)$"



=

However this doesn' seem to work: images still appear in the crawl log. Do=
es someone have any suggestion on why this happens?

Thank you very much

M=
atteo
